home.title: Hiking and GPS Track Management Tool (GPX)
home.subTitle: Trailence is free and open source. No ads, no trackers.
home.meta_description: Hiking and GPS Track Management Tool (GPX). Trailence is free, ad-free, and open source

footer: Record a track during your activity
Enhance your tracks with the editing tool
Plan a hike with Open Street Map

home.available_on: Available on Android and web application

installApk.title: Android App

stores.intro: Trailence is available on the Google Play Store, Huawei AppGallery, and Uptodown. Simply click one of the images below to open the store:
stores.else1: If you can't (or prefer not to) use these stores, you can still install Trailence via its APK file.
stores.else2: Once installed, Trailence will let you know when updates are available. If you choose to install it, the new version will be automatically downloaded and installed - no need to repeat the full setup process.
stores.else3: To install Trailence manually, follow these steps:

installApk.meta_description: Instructions for installing the Trailence Android app

steps.beforeImg: A window similar to the one below may appear
steps.afterImg: Confirm the download, then open the file

steps.beforeImg: If this is the first time you are installing an app this way, an alert similar to the one below may appear
steps.afterImg: Go to settings to allow installation
Click on Allow from this source

steps.beforeImg: A window will then appear to confirm the installation
A window similar to the one below will then appear
steps.afterImg: Click on More details in the middle of the screen

steps.beforeImg: The screen will then display an Install without scanning button
steps.afterImg: You can click on it, or request a scan if you prefer

share_popup.title: Share

type.question: What would you like to share?

explanation.collection: All trails in the collection will be shared. If you add, remove, or edit a trail in the collection, the share will be automatically updated.
explanation.tags: Only trails in the collection with the selected tags (on the next page) will be shared. If you tag a new trail with one of the selected tags, it will be automatically added to the share. Likewise, if you remove a tag from a trail, the share will be updated.

preferences.title: Preferences
preferences.alias: How would you like to appear publicly?
preferences.alias_explaination: When you publish a track or leave a comment on a public track, you can choose to remain anonymous or display a name of your choice. If you choose a name, please make sure it does not contain any offensive, abusive, or discriminatory language.
preferences.traceMinMeters: Minimum distance between each recorded point
preferences.traceMinMeters_explaination:
If the value is too low, the track quality may decrease due to GPS imprecision.
A value that is too high also lead to a low-quality track with long straight lines.
Additionally, shorter distances result in more recorded points, which can increase battery consumption.
We recommend setting the value between 5 and 15 meters (approximately 16 to 50 foot) for a good balance.
preferences.traceMinMillis: Minimum time between each recorded point
preferences.traceMinMillis_explaination:
To limit the number of recorded points and reduce battery consumption, you can increase the minimum time between each point. Both the minimum time and minimum distance must be met before recording a new point.
We recommend setting it between 2 and 5 seconds.
preferences.offlineMapMaxKeepDays: Number of days a downloaded map is valid
preferences.offlineMapMaxKeepDays_explaination: When you download a map to make it available offline, this setting defines how long it will be retained. It also prevents re-downloading a map if it was recently downloaded, saving time.
preferences.photos_max_pixels_explaination: When you add a photo larger than the maximum size, it will be automatically resized.
preferences.photos_max_quality_explaination: Photos are automatically converted to JPEG format, and this setting determines the compression quality. 100% provides maximum quality with low compression. We recommend setting it around 75% for a good balance of quality and compression.
preferences.photos_max_size_kb_explaination: When you store a photo, the maximum pixel size and quality are applied. If the result is a file size larger than this value, the size and quality will be slightly reduced until the file size is below this threshold.
preferences.photos_cache_explaination: When a photo is displayed, it is downloaded and then cached on your device. This avoids having to download a photo each time, and therefore makes the display faster. It also allows you to view photos offline. So, if you plan to follow a track that contains photos, and you want to be able to view the photos offline during your hike, by viewing the photos before you start the hike while you have network access, they will be available offline.
preferences.thunderforest_explaination: You can add maps from thunderforest.com if you have an account on their web site (a free account is available). Enter your API key below

time_calculation.title: Calculation of hike duration
time_calculation.base_speed_explaination: This speed is used to estimate the hike duration. It is weighted according to the elevation and duration. By default the value is 3.1 mi/h (5 km/h), which corresponds to the average speed of a hiker.
time_calculation.long_break_explaination:
When displaying a hike's duration, we distinguish short stops (to take a break, admire the view, etc.) and long stops (like a picnic).

Short stops are included in the total duration, as it's normal to have brief pauses. However, when a long stop is detected, it's duration is deducted from the hike time so the time shown doesn't depend on how long you took a nap üòâ. The deducted time appears in the Breaks section.

To detect long stops, you can configure two parameters: a perimeter and a minimum duration. A stop is considered long when you stay within this perimeter for at least the set minimum time.

donation.title: Contribute
donation.header: Thank you for considering helping this project!
donation.text:
Trailence is free, ad-free, and open-source.

In order to remain so, we would like to ask for your help.

We are transparent about our costs, and what your donations are used for.
  - We currently pay 67 euros per year for hosting (a basic server + the domain name).
  - We have 100GB of storage space for 20 euros.

descriptions.future_costs: Ensure sustainability by covering expenses for 2 additional years
descriptions.increase_capacity: Increase capacity for all users (more storage, server can serve more users)

developer.title: Are You a Developer?

developer.message2: In particular, one contribution we‚Äôre looking for is developing the app for iOS. Since we use Ionic, only a few native features are required.

publications.publish_confirmation: By confirming the publication of this track, you affirm that you have complied with the rules and confirm that this track can be made public
publications.publish_message_placeholder: If you would like to leave a message for the moderator who will review your track, you can enter it here.

start_popup.header: Thank you for contributing to the Trailence community!
start_popup.text_before: You‚Äôre about to publish your track, which will make it visible to all users. Here‚Äôs some important information about how publishing works:

bullets.text: The published track is a copy of your original track. This means any changes you make to the track you‚Äôre about to publish will not affect your original, private track. Likewise, if you later modify your original track, it won‚Äôt affect the published version.
At first, the track will be saved as a ‚ÄúDraft‚Äù. This lets you prepare it for publication and make any adjustments you‚Äôd like before submitting it.
During this phase, you‚Äôll be guided by a checklist to help you review key points before publishing. Among them:
Any offensive, abusive, or discriminatory content is strictly forbidden.
Remove any personal information you don‚Äôt wish to make public.
Do not include photos where people are recognizable.
Once your draft is ready, you can submit it for review. A moderator may then check it to ensure the rules are respected.
After validation, your track will be visible to the entire community!
You‚Äôll still be able to edit or remove your published track at any time if you wish.

start_popup.text_after: Thank you for your participation ‚Äî and happy publishing!

edit_popup.title: Edit a Published Trail
edit_popup.message: The trail will be copied to your drafts. Editing works just like for a first publication: once your changes are made, they will be reviewed by a moderator. Do you confirm you want to edit this publication?

iam_author.title: Copyright and permissions
iam_author.description_start: ¬©Ô∏è Make sure you are the author of the information you publish, or that you have obtained explicit permission from the author to publish it on Trailence.

name.title: Trail name
name.description_start: The name should be short and clearly describe the goal of the track. Here are a few examples:
description_bullets: Emerald Lake and Yoho Valley: clear and to the point.
Mount Hood via Timberline Trail: indicates both the destination and the chosen route if there are several options.
From Bondi to Coogee via the Coastal Walk: describes the starting point, destination, and route if relevant.

description.title: Trail description
description.description_start: The description should help users quickly understand what to expect along the track. Make sure to include:
description_bullets: Any potential difficulties (type and where they occur)
Viewpoints, points of interest, or notable features
The type of path (trail, wide track, road‚Ä¶) and an idea of the proportions if necessary
Whether the track is mostly in the forest, open terrain, mountainous‚Ä¶
Useful advice on the best time of year to hike it
If the track is varied, a description of the main stages (e.g. forest at the start, chapel halfway, panoramic ridge at the end‚Ä¶)
Finish with practical information if relevant: parking availability, water points, etc.

activity.title: Type of activity provided
activity.description_start: Make sure to clearly distinguish between walking and hiking: If the track is short, with little elevation gain and few difficulties, or if it‚Äôs an urban route, it‚Äôs more appropriate to classify it as walking. Hiking usually refers to tracks in nature, typically over an hour long, often with elevation gain...

track.title: Track quality
track.description_start: If possible, try to improve the quality of your track:
description_bullets: Fix any elevation values that seem incorrect.
If you left the main route (for a short technical break ü§≠ for example), try to remove those sections from the track.
track.description_end: üëâ To do this, use the Edit button on the map.

waypoints.title: Waypoints
waypoints.description_start: Consider adding waypoints to your track:
description_bullets: They can be used to mark specific spots: a viewpoint, a landmark, a water source‚Ä¶
Most importantly, they help give direction instructions, especially at places where the route isn‚Äôt obvious on site (like at a crossroads, or if the trail is poorly marked).
waypoints.description_end: üëâ To do this, use the Edit button on the map, select the desired location, and open the Waypoint menu.

photos.title: Photos
photos.description_start: Consider adding photos that make people want to follow your track: beautiful landscapes, scenic viewpoints, unusual spots‚Ä¶
description_bullets: üìç Check that each photo is correctly positioned on the track if this wasn‚Äôt done automatically.
‚ö†Ô∏è Do not publish photos where people are recognizable.
üôè Also avoid sharing photos of private property without permission.

moderation.publish_confirmation: Do you confirm this trail can be made public?
moderation.reject_message_placeholder: Please enter a message here to explain why this track cannot be published.

offline_map.download_trail: Maps corresponding to the track will be downloaded to be available offline
offline_map.download_map: Maps of the currently displayed area will be downloaded to be available offline
offline_map.max_zoom_explaination: The higher you select a zoom level, the more you will be able to zoom during your hike when you are offline, but consequently the longer the download will take and the more storage space will be required on your device.
offline_map.max_zoom_reco: A value between 15 and 17 is recommended. Below 15, the level of detail is often too low to see small paths clearly. Above 17, the download size is large, and is generally not necessary to perfectly follow a route.
offline_map.padding_explaination_for_trail: Percentage of the area to download in around the track area (100% means only the track area). Allows you to see more around the track in offline mode.
offline_map.padding_explaination_for_map: Percentage of the area to download in around the currently displayed area (100% means only the track area). Allows you to see a larger area in offline mode.

Using the web app may lead to limitations: lower GPS accuracy, and especially the risk of recording stopping when you‚Äôre no longer on the app (screen off, switching to another page, or using a different app), as the browser may stop sending GPS coordinates.

obsolete_message.title: Update required
obsolete_message.message: Your application is in an outdated version and needs to be updated. By using this version, your changes cannot be saved to the server and may be lost.

track_edit_tools.title: Edit

slope_threshold.explaination:
Smoothing helps correct GPS inaccuracies, making the trail appear as a continuous slope rather than showing irregular elevation changes.
This is done by:
  • Identifying sections where altitude changes within the configured threshold and distance.
  • Smoothing these sections into a continuous slope while keeping high or low points intact.

selection.title: Selection
selection.select_target_point: Select a point on the map or elevation chart to extend the selection to that point
selection.remove_all_next_points: Remove all points after this one
selection.remove_all_previous_points: Remove all points before this one

remove_selection.button_single_label_and_join: Delete the selected point and reconnect the track
remove_selection.button_multiple_label_and_join: Delete the selected section and reconnect the track
remove_selection.button_single_label_and_open: Delete the selected point and split the track into two
remove_selection.button_multiple_label_and_open: Delete the selected section and split the track into two

tools.back_to_departure: Create a return to the start by following the same route
tools.start_from_arrival: Fill in the missing start by following the return path back to the finish
tools.back_to_original_track: Back to original trace without improvements
tools.link_to_next_segment_with_line: Connect to the next section with a straight line
tools.link_to_next_segment_follow: Connect to the next section by following the path

set_elevation_on_range.with_start: Using the one from the first selected point
set_elevation_on_range.with_end: Using the one from the last selected point
set_elevation_on_range.smoothing: By smoothing from the first to the last selected point
set_elevation_on_range.manual_value: By entering a fixed altitude manually
set_elevation_on_range.manual_diff: By entering a difference to apply

tools.apply_default_improvements: Apply default enhancements (those used when creating a trace)

track_edit_tools.no_modification: No changes were made by this function

toast_anonymous_account: When using the app without an account, your data is stored only in your browser and may be automatically deleted if your browser runs out of space. To save and sync your data, you can export it, create an account, and then import it again.

accepted.text: Your trail :*:/trail/trailence/{{2}}:*:{{1}}:*: has been published! Thank you for contributing to the community üéâ

rejected.text: The publication of your trail :*:/trail/{{3}}/{{2}}:*:{{1}}:*: has been declined. Check it to see the reason and make the necessary improvements.

new_share_with_you.text: {{1}} has shared something new with you: :*:/trails/share/{{3}}/{{1}}:*:{{2}}:*:

someone_leave_a_comment.text: Someone left a comment on your trail :*:/trail/trailence/{{1}}:*:{{2}}:*:

someone_leave_a_rate_with_comment.text: Someone rated and commented on your trail :*:/trail/trailence/{{1}}:*:{{2}}:*:

reply.text: Someone replied to your comment on the trail :*:/trail/trailence/{{1}}:*:{{2}}:*:
